t: 1 Peter 2
As Newborn Babes
Therefore,*p putting aside all malice and all deceit and hypocrisy and envy and all slander,
like newborn babies, long for the pure milk of the word, so that by it you may grow in respect to salvation,
if you have tasted the kindness of the Lord.
As Living Stones
And*p coming to Him as to a living stone which has been rejected by men, but is choice and precious in the sight of God,
you also, as living stones, are being built up as a spiritual house for a holy priesthood, to offer up spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.

For this*i is contained in Scripture: “Behold,*spn I lay*s in*s Zion*s a*s choice*s stone,*s a*s precious*s corner*s stone,*i And*ln he*s who*s believes*s in*s Him*s will*s not*s be*s disappointed.”*s
This*p precious value, then, is for you who believe; but for those who disbelieve, “The*spn stone*s which*s the*s builders*s rejected,*s This*sln became*s the*s very*s corner*s stone,”*i
and,*p “A*pn stone*s of*s stumbling*s and*s a*s rock*s of*s offense”;*s for*p they stumble because they are disobedient to the word, and to this doom*i they were also appointed.

But*p you are a*s chosen*s race,*s a*s royal priesthood,*s a*s holy*s nation,*s a*s people*s for*s God’s*i own*s possession,*s so that you may proclaim the excellencies of Him who has called you out of darkness into His marvelous light;
for you once were not*s a*s people,*s but now you are the*s people*s of*s God;*s you had not*s received*s mercy,*s but now you have received*s mercy.*s
Beloved,*p I urge you as aliens and strangers to abstain from fleshly lusts which wage war against the soul.

Keep your behavior excellent among the Gentiles, so that in the thing in which they slander you as evildoers, they may because of your good deeds, as they observe them,*i glorify God in the day of visitation.
Honor Authority
Submit*p yourselves for the Lord’s sake to every human institution, whether to a king as the one in authority,
or to governors as sent by him for the punishment of evildoers and the praise of those who do right.
For such is the will of God that by doing right you may silence the ignorance of foolish men.
Act*i as free men, and do not use your freedom as a covering for evil, but use*i it*i as bondslaves of God.
Honor all people, love the brotherhood, fear God, honor the king.
Servants,*p be submissive to your masters with all respect, not only to those who are good and gentle, but also to those who are unreasonable.
For this finds*i favor, if for the sake of conscience toward God a person bears up under sorrows when suffering unjustly.

For what credit is there if, when you sin and are harshly treated, you endure it with patience? But if when you do what is right and suffer for*i it*i you patiently endure it, this finds*i favor with God.
Christ Is Our Example
For*p you have been called for this purpose, since Christ also suffered for you, leaving you an example for you to follow in His steps,
who*s committed*s no*s sin,*s nor*s was*s any*s deceit*s found*s in*s His*s mouth;*s
and while being reviled, He did not revile in return; while suffering, He uttered no threats, but kept entrusting Himself*i to Him who judges righteously;
and He Himself bore our sins in His body on the cross, so that we might die to sin and live to righteousness; for by His wounds you were healed.
For you were continually straying like sheep, but now you have returned to the Shepherd and Guardian of your souls.
